alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 6:44AM EDT until July 31 at 6:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson, affecting Breathitt County. ...A FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is still occurring. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...The Flood warning is in effect until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Large sections of the town are inundated at stages above 43 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 43.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage reported was 43.5 feet at 2:30 AM. This is a new flood of record, exceeding the old reading of 43.1 feet on February 4th in 1939. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...The previous flood of record was 43.1 feet on 02/04/1939. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by noon.
